intro: Heterochiton fontanesii subsp. bollei, commonly known as the Bolle's heterochiton, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cooler, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
